setAffectedLayers

public void setAffectedLayers(int num)
This will set the number of layers to affect, the default is 1 - the layer specified in commitPaint.

Parameters:
num - the number of layers to affect.

startPaint

public void startPaint(MultilayerPlane mp,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       int button,
                       int layer)
Description copied from interface: Brush
Called before painting operation starts. This is when the mouse is initially pressed.

Specified by:
startPaint in interface Brush
Parameters:
mp - the MultilayerPlane to be affected.
x - the tile x-coordinate where the user initiated the paint.
y - the tile y-coordinate where the user initiated the paint.
button - the mouse button that was used.
layer - the selected layer.
See Also:
MultilayerPlane

doPaint

public java.awt.Rectangle doPaint(int x,
                                  int y)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: Brush
This is the main processing method for a brush. This method should only be called between calls to startPaint and endPaint.

Specified by:
doPaint in interface Brush
Parameters:
x - the tile x-coordinate of the mouse.
y - the tile y-coordinate of the mouse.
Returns:
the rectangular region affected by the painting, used to determine which area to redraw.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

endPaint

public void endPaint()
Description copied from interface: Brush
Called when painting operation finishes. This is when the mouse is released.

Specified by:
endPaint in interface Brush

drawPreview

public void drawPreview(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d,
                        java.awt.Dimension dimension,
                        MapView mv)
Description copied from interface: Brush
Draws a preview of the editing operation when applicable. This is meant for off-map brush preview. The map view is provided for drawing map-view dependant previews.

Specified by:
drawPreview in interface Brush
Parameters:
g2d - The graphics context to draw to.
dimension - The dimension within which the preview should be drawn
mv - The active map view.
